profile:
Thermal Imaging (Infrared Camera) used with every home inspection.  
AMBICORP PROPERTY INSPECTIONS. Certified, Trusted, Professional.  

Certified Professional Inspector (NACHI13100304)
Certified Mold Inspector (IAC2-03-2017)

Be sure to check our website
www.ambicorpinspections.ca

416-209-3444

As your Home and Mold Inspector,  Ambicorp Property Inspections look beyond the aesthetic attributes of a home and inspect for defects or deficiencies that may lead to costly repairs in the future.  I conduct a full inspection of the property's interior and exterior.  There is no pass or fail on a home inspection, rather a thorough report of any defects observed, indicating the condition of the home and the resulting recommendations to the client.  As my client, you will have the knowledge you need to make an informed decision on your biggest purchase and investment and the place that you will call home.

Specializing in Residential Home Inspections, Mold Inspections, Mold Testing and Indoor Air Quality Testing.
​​Centrally located, servicing clients in Toronto, Vaughan, Markham, York, Peel and Durham Regions. 
​​Inspection of all types of residential properties from detached houses to condominiums.
​​Trained and experienced in defect recognition and know what to look for and where to look to help identify any potential problems with a property.​​​​

Member of International Association of Certified Indoor Air Consultants (IAC2)

Member of International Association of Certified Home Inspectors (InterNACHI)

​​Member of Canadian National Association of Certified Home Inspectors (CanNACHI) 

Continuous education and training annually as a condition of certification and membership.
​Mold & Indoor Air Quality Testing using our PRO-LAB partners.  Lab results obtained the next day.
​​Trained in the use of Thermal Imaging (Infrared Camera) during all of our inspections.
service_area: Toronto, GTA, York Region, Peel Region, Durham Region, Halton Region
services:
Pre-Purchase Inspections,
Pre-Listing Inspections,
Tarion Inspections,
Mold Inspections,
Air Quality Testing,
Thermal (Infrared) Imaging
specialities:
A Complete Top to Bottom Inspection of the Home - ​Roofs, Gutters & Downspouts, Vents, Chimneys, Basement, Foundation, Structure, Drainage, Attics, Insulation & Ventilation, Flashings, Valleys, Eaves, Soffit & Fascia, Windows & Doors, Floors, Walls & Ceilings, Brick, Siding & Stucco, Decks, Porches, Garages, Driveways, Heating & Cooling, Plumbing & Electrical.  Thermal Imaging (Infrared Camera) is used for all inspections.

​

    Same Day Inspection Report - With the option of a PDF or web based report, you can view the report from anywhere using a laptop, tablet or smartphone.  The report contains colour photos of the defects, colour illustrations and the resulting recommendations.  The report also contains helpful links to online articles for your reference.


    ​​The Latest Home Inspection Technology ​- For home inspections we use the latest non-invasive technology, tools and instruments, including Thermal Imaging, SpectoScope, Moisture Meter, Combustible Gas Detector, Laser Thermometer, Hygrometer, Boroscope, Electrical Testers, Voltage Detectors among other tools. We inspect all major components of the home from the exterior to the interior.


    ​A Home Inspection Reference Book - "Now That You Have Had a Home Inspection" is a book that is provided to you upon completion of the inspection.  This book contains helpful tips on maintaining your home, saving energy and how your home works.  This book is an excellent source of helpful information for experienced home owners and first time buyers.

​

    Lab Results Obtained the Next Day - A detailed lab report is provided the next day for Mold Inspections.  In addition to taking mold samples for laboratory analysis, we also do Indoor Air Quality Testing to check for the presence of mold spores in the air.  Samples are sent to our PRO-LAB partners in Vaughan and samples are analyzed for the presence of mold, lead or asbestos.  The lab report details the species of mold, the spore concentration and any known health problems or allergic reactions that may be associated with the mold.   Some people have allergies to pets such as dogs and cats, while others have allergies or concerns about cockroaches, rats, mice and dust mites.  Did you know we also test the air for allergens?  Contact us​ for more details.

​

    ​A Certified Home and Mold Inspector ​- You will have an inspection conducted by a qualified and certified inspector who is trained and experienced in finding defects that may require repairs in the future.  Your inspector will provide unmatched service and gives his full attention to you and the home inspection and answering all of your questions.

​

    Support After Moving In ​- We take pride in providing support to clients after they take possession of their home.  We are only a phone call away to answer any of your questions.  To us, servicing a client is more than just a transaction, rather its an enjoyable overall experience.​
name: Ambicorp Property Inspections

profile:
Buying a home can be an anxious time, often filled with excitement, worry or even regret. As a home buyer, whether its your first time or tenth, there are pitfalls to avoid, clues to interpret and surprises to prevent. Quantum Home Inspections possess a superior mix of experience and education to help you understand and become familiar with the condition of your new home. We will answer all the important questions you may have about the condition and care of the property under consideration and will be provided with a detailed report including photos of defects taken during the inspection.

You are welcome and encouraged to join us during your home inspection, from start to finish, so you may learn about the property first hand and the serviceability of the home’s various components as well as gain insight on how they all work together. You will walk away with ‘Peace of Mind’.

Our services include: Thermal Imaging, Pre-Listing Inspection, Pre-Purchase Inspection, Pre-Delivery Inspection (PDI), New Home Warranty Inspection (TARION), Indoor Air Quality Testing for Mold, Radon Testing. We service the GTA and surrounding areas including City of Toronto, Scarborough, Vaughan, Markham, King, Stoufville, East Gwillimbury, Georgina, Uxbridge, Pickering, Ajax, Oshawa, Whitby, Clarington, Scugog, Brock, Burlington, Milton, Oakville, Halton Hills, Caledon, Brampton, Mississauga.

profile:
Safe Homes Canada Home Inspection is a civil-engineering-based home inspection company that has been committed to integrity and excellence for a quarter of a century.
 
In the home inspection industry there is a difference! All of our home and building inspectors are Civil Engineering or Architectural Technology graduates are also members of PHPIC (Professional Home and Property Inspectors of Canada). Our custom-typed reports are driven by and grounded in the vernacular of building sciences and are GUARANTEED.
 
We’re proud to offer the most qualified home inspectors in Ontario and the GTA!After each thorough, top to bottom home inspection we provide you with a custom home inspection report so you have a clear understanding of every point of the home inspection.
 
Forget about checkmarks and confusing builders’ codes…
Unlike many other home inspectors’ reports, a Safe Homes Canada home inspection report is written in common language and includes recommendations on what needs to be done to resolve any issues we find.
 
Don’t risk costly surprises when you buy your next home. Call Safe Homes Canada first!
specialities: A commitment to excellence and integrity for over 25 years.

profile:
A professional inspection will significantly reduce your risk and help make the entire home buying process easier and less stressful. Legacy Home Inspections really enjoys helping our clients. In this process, customer service is our highest priority.

Legacy Home Inspections is an independently owned and operated home inspection business. We offer the highest quality of customer service in the industry. With more than 19 years of experience in the construction and home inspection industry we have performed thousands of inspections since 2004. We have the experience, training and knowledge, to provide you with the security and peace of mind you are looking for. We are proud to be your inspection service provider. Whether you are buying or selling, we can help you through the whole process with confidence. A home is the single largest investment and asset that most people own. We offer a premium service with detailed and unbiased reports to ensure that you have an accurate understanding of the subject property. We strive to continually raise the bar in the building inspection industry.

We offer more than just a look into our client's home, we also want to ensure that you know your home. Our goal is to have you understand your property. Our home inspections are intended to educate by giving you a needed understanding of the property, an overview of how the systems in the home work, how the systems of the home work in conjunction with each other, and how they should be maintained throughout the change of seasons and over the years.

Why choose Legacy Home Inspections? Because we care.

profile: Dive Deep Home Inspections is a residential home inspection company made up of Certified Home Inspectors who have residential construction and renovation experience. Inspectors who know how the systems of your home should actually function. Your home is the largest investment you will make in you lifetime. Whether you are just looking to buy, preparing to sell the one you have, or maybe just looking to make sure its well maintained, let us have a look. Dive Deep Home Inspections only works with Certified Home Inspectors who have past residential construction or renovation experience. We know homes from the ground up. A proper home inspection, sometimes called a Field Performance Review, consists of a visual inspection and tests using the standard operating controls, of the major systems in your home. Systems which include roofing, structure, exterior, interior and insulation, plumbing, electrical, and of course your heating and air conditioning. Don't trust such a detailed inspection to just anyone. Our certified and experienced inspectors know how these systems should function. All inspections are documented in a report, that includes full colour pictures, and diagrams and links that help you to understand your inspectors findings. Your report comes to you by email within 24 hours and you will have access to your inspectors for as long as you need for questions and/or explanations. Let us Dive Deep into your home!

profile:
Welcome to Pillar To Post Home Inspectors. We call what we do The Moment of Truth. It is the moment when the emotion of buying and selling a home meets the reality of the issues of that home. Our work is to communicate effectively, knowledgeably, efficiently, and openly about the condition of a home. We understand that our customers trust us to inform and educate them about what we see and what we find, and this is a trust we hold in the highest regard. 

Our Services: Radon Testing, Air Quality / Mould Testing, Pool and Spa Inspections, Infrared Inspections. 



Real estate professionals:

For real estate professionals, our work is a commitment to the understanding that their reputation is our responsibility and that a relationship with us reinforces the confidence their clients have in them.

Home buyers:

For the home buyer, our work is an objective explanation of the condition of the potential new home to which an emotional tie is already being formed.

Home sellers:

For the home seller our work is to honor the home they have lived in, and to report on its condition observed at the time of the inspection.

For all of our customers, Pillar To Post considers the home a place of the heart, as it houses the people that are loved and the memories of lifetimes. This is why we call Pillar To Post The Home of Home Inspection.


*** Covid 19 Update - We are following all healthy and safety guidelines as directed by the Province of Ontario to ensure the safety of our customers and employees. While onsite, we will ensure we wear masks, use hand sanitizer and practive social distancing ***

Joe has been a Lighthouse Home Inspector for the past four years and brings years of experience in home renovations, customer service and property and mechanical maintenance to each and every inspection he performs.

Our primary objective at Lighthouse Home Inspections is to assess the quality and overall condition of the home and to provide you, our client, with recommendations and knowledge when it comes to preventative maintenance.  Joe will examine and assess virtually all areas of the home, including: the exterior, structure, roofing, windows, doors, overall interior, heating and cooling equipment, plumbing fixtures and electrical systems to identify deficiencies and provide guidance to maintain a healthy and safe home.

Joe’s goal is to not only provide information but also to educate the client.
